Description: Severe hyperglycemia is defined as CGM_mmol > 13.9.
High glucose (CGM_mmol > 10) during nocturnal hours (0-6 AM).
Significant spikes (>2 mmol/L increase) after meals (proxy: large positive CGM_diff) when overall glucose is high.
High overall risk of abnormal glucose and elevated average glucose.
High glucose variability despite a relatively lower risk of being in abnormal zones, suggesting erratic patterns.
Moderate overall risk of abnormal glucose or elevated average glucose.
Default recommendation if no other specific clinical condition is met.
